SEARCH
Package sprouts

Interface Problem

public interface Problem
A problem is a wrapper for information describing an issue that can be reported and attached to a Result. It is used to describe what went wrong in a process. Like for example the process of obtaining a value, which is why it is also part of a Result that does not contain a value (null).
The Problem exposes various properties that describe what went wrong, such as a title, a description, an optional reporter object and an optional Exception that was thrown while obtaining the value.

This type has been designed to complement Java exceptions. Exceptions are great for us developers, because they halt the current execution and give us a stack trace we can debug, but they do not always fail as gracefully as a user might expect. In a complex system where lots of things can go wrong you want to catch exceptions and then collect them in a list of problems like so: 

  	thingsThatWentWrong.add(Problem.of(myException));
This way your application continues to run and collect all the relevant problems that occurred so that they can then either be logged or presented to the user in a more graceful way.

  • Method Details

    • of

      static Problem of(Exception e)
      A factory method for creating a problem from an Exception. The title of the problem will be the name of the exception class, the description will be the message of the exception (or cause if there is no message). The exception will be stored in the problem and can be retrieved with exception().
      Parameters:
      e - The exception to create a problem from.
      Returns:
      A problem that describes the given exception.

    • of

      static Problem of(String title)
      A factory method for creating a problem with a title (and no description).
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the problem, which may not be null.
      Returns:
      A problem with the given title and description.

    • of

      static Problem of(String title, String description)
      A factory method for creating a problem with a title and a description.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the problem, which may not be null.
      description - The description of the problem, which may not be null.
      Returns:
      A problem with the given title and description.

    • of

      static Problem of(Object reporter, String title, String description)
      A factory method for creating a problem with a title, a description and a reporter.
      Parameters:
      reporter - The reporter of the problem, which may not be null.
      title - The title of the problem, which may not be null.
      description - The description of the problem, which may not be null.
      Returns:
      A problem with the given title and description.

    • title

      String title()
      Every problem has a title, which serves as a short, descriptive identifier. If a problem object is created from an exception, the title will be the name of the exception class.
      Returns:
      The title of the problem, which may not be null (but may be empty).

    • description

      String description()
      A problem may have a description, which provides more detailed information about what went wrong. If a problem object is created from an exception, the description will be the message of the exception (or cause if there is no message).
      Returns:
      The description of the problem, which may not be null (but may be empty).

    • exception

      default Optional<Exception> exception()
      A problem object may or may not have an exception attached to it. It is assumed that this exception is the cause of the problem.
      Returns:
      The exception that was thrown while obtaining the value, if any.

    • reporter

      default Optional<Object> reporter()
      A problem object may or may not have a reporter attached to it. It is expected to be the object where the problem originated from.
      Returns:
      The object that reported the problem, if any.
